verses.verse: Whoever loves <S%H157><s%> correction <S%H4148><s%> loves <S%H157><s%> knowledge, <S%H1847><s%> but he who hates <S%H8130><s%> reproof <S%H8433><s%> is stupid. <S%H1198><s%>
A good <S%H2896><s%> man shall obtain <S%H6329><s%> favor <S%H7522><s%> from Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> but he will condemn <S%H7561><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> of wicked devices. <S%H4209><s%>
A man <S%H120><s%> shall not be established <S%H3559><s%> by wickedness, <S%H7562><s%> but the root <S%H8328><s%> of the righteous <S%H6662><s%> shall not be moved. <S%H4131><s%>
A worthy <S%H2428><s%> woman <S%H802><s%> is the crown <S%H5850><s%> of her husband, <S%H1167><s%> but a disgraceful <S%H954><s%> wife is as rottenness <S%H7538><s%> in his bones. <S%H6106><s%>
The thoughts <S%H4284><s%> of the righteous <S%H6662><s%> are just, <S%H4941><s%> but the advice of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> is deceitful. <S%H4820><s%>
The words <S%H1697><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> are about lying in wait <S%H693><s%> for blood, <S%H1818><s%> but the speech <S%H6310><s%> of the upright <S%H3477><s%> rescues them. <S%H5337><s%>
The wicked <S%H7563><s%> are overthrown, <S%H2015><s%> and are no more, <S%H1004><s%> but the house of the righteous <S%H6662><s%> shall stand. <S%H5975><s%>
A man <S%H376><s%> shall be commended <S%H1984><s%> according <S%H6310><s%> to his wisdom, <S%H7922><s%> but he who has a warped mind <S%H3820><s%> shall be despised. <S%H937><s%>
Better <S%H2896><s%> is he who is lightly esteemed, <S%H7034><s%> and has a servant, <S%H5650><s%> than he who honors <S%H3513><s%> himself, <S%H2638><s%> and lacks bread. <S%H3899><s%>
A righteous <S%H6662><s%> man respects <S%H3045><s%> the life <S%H5315><s%> of his animal, <S%H929><s%> but the tender mercies <S%H7356><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> are cruel. <S%H394><s%>

He who tills <S%H5647><s%> his land <S%H127><s%> shall have plenty <S%H7646><s%> of bread, <S%H3899><s%> but he who chases <S%H7291><s%> fantasies <S%H7386><s%> is void <S%H2638><s%> of understanding. <S%H3820><s%>
The wicked <S%H7563><s%> desires <S%H2530><s%> the plunder <S%H4685><s%> of evil <S%H7451><s%> men, <S%H8328><s%> but the root of the righteous <S%H6662><s%> flourishes. <S%H5414><s%>
An evil <S%H7451><s%> man is trapped <S%H4170><s%> by sinfulness <S%H6588><s%> of lips, <S%H8193><s%> but the righteous <S%H6662><s%> shall come out <S%H3318><s%> of trouble. <S%H6869><s%>

A man <S%H376><s%> shall be satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with good <S%H2896><s%> by the fruit <S%H6529><s%> of his mouth. <S%H6310><s%> The work <S%H1576><s%> of a man <S%H120><s%>'s hands <S%H3027><s%> shall be rewarded to him. <S%H7725><s%>
The way <S%H1870><s%> of a fool <S%H191><s%> is right <S%H3477><s%> in his own eyes, <S%H5869><s%> but he who is wise <S%H2450><s%> listens <S%H8085><s%> to counsel. <S%H6098><s%>
A fool <S%H191><s%> shows <S%H3045><s%> his annoyance <S%H3708><s%> the same day, <S%H3117><s%> but one who overlooks <S%H3680><s%> an insult <S%H7036><s%> is prudent. <S%H6175><s%>
He who is truthful <S%H530><s%> testifies <S%H6315><s%> honestly, <S%H6664><s%> <S%H5046><s%> but a false <S%H8267><s%> witness <S%H5707><s%> lies. <S%H4820><s%>
There is <S%H3426><s%> one who speaks <S%H981><s%> rashly like the piercing <S%H4094><s%> of a sword, <S%H2719><s%> but the tongue <S%H3956><s%> of the wise <S%H2450><s%> heals. <S%H4832><s%>
Truth <S%H571><s%>'s lips <S%H8193><s%> will be established <S%H3559><s%> forever, <S%H5703><s%> but a lying <S%H8267><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%> is only momentary. <S%H7280><s%>
Deceit <S%H4820><s%> is in the heart <S%H3820><s%> of those who plot <S%H2790><s%> evil, <S%H7451><s%> but joy <S%H8057><s%> comes to the promoters <S%H3289><s%> of peace. <S%H7965><s%>
No mischief <S%H205><s%> shall happen <S%H579><s%> to the righteous, <S%H6662><s%> but the wicked <S%H7563><s%> shall be filled <S%H4390><s%> with evil. <S%H7451><s%>
Lying <S%H8267><s%> lips <S%H8193><s%> are an abomination <S%H8441><s%> to Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> but those who do <S%H6213><s%> the truth <S%H530><s%> are his delight. <S%H7522><s%>
A prudent <S%H6175><s%> man <S%H120><s%> keeps <S%H3680><s%> his knowledge, <S%H1847><s%> but the hearts <S%H3820><s%> of fools <S%H3684><s%> proclaim <S%H7121><s%> foolishness. <S%H200><s%>
The hands <S%H3027><s%> of the diligent <S%H2742><s%> ones shall rule, <S%H4910><s%> but laziness <S%H7423><s%> ends in slave labor. <S%H4522><s%>
Anxiety <S%H1674><s%> in a man <S%H376><s%>'s heart <S%H3820><s%> weighs it down, <S%H7812><s%> but a kind <S%H2896><s%> word <S%H1697><s%> makes it glad. <S%H8055><s%>
A righteous <S%H6662><s%> person is cautious <S%H8446><s%> in friendship, <S%H7453><s%> but the way <S%H1870><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> leads them astray. <S%H7563><s%>
The slothful <S%H7423><s%> man doesn't <S%H2760><s%> roast his game, <S%H6718><s%> but the possessions <S%H1952><s%> of diligent <S%H2742><s%> men <S%H120><s%> are prized. <S%H3368><s%>
In the way <S%H734><s%> of righteousness <S%H6666><s%> is life; <S%H2416><s%> in its path <S%H5410><s%> there is no death. <S%H4194><s%>
